titles.title: A resolution expressing the profound concerns of the Senate regarding the transgression against freedom of thought and expression that is being carried out in Venezuela, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Biden without amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 178.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 5/24/2007--Passed Senate without amendment. Expresses profound concern about the transgression against freedom of thought and expression in Venezuela by President Hugo Chavez's refusal to renew the concession of Radio Caracas Television. Encourages the Organization of American States (OAS) to respond appropriately to such transgression.
